title: [Game Design] @Meddler What's Riot's Stance on CDR?
body:
I'm perplexed...

1. In pre-season, when Essence Reaver was released, lots of mage players complained that ADC had better access to CDR than mages. Reds answered that ADCs were allowed that because they didn't scale so much with CDR, but Mages who would scale harder should have to make a choice, a trade-off between high utility up-time (with CDR) or high damage burst (with AP).
2. In mid-season, two seemingly contradictory changes were made:
   * 3 new AP-items with CDR were introduced, it's now much easier to get CDR on mages ==> they shouldn't have to make a trade-off anymore?
   * Athene's was changed into a utility item and was allowed to keep its mana regen, "because mages who go for utility instead a damage are allowed to have more up-time" ==> so the trade-off is still in effect?

So the question is: 
**What does Riot currently think about CDR? When and why full-CDR builds should be available? On what classes of champs? Are they happy with the current CDR itemization?**

Thanks :)

replies.body:
We believe CDR's something all classes should have good access to. In a lot of cases scaling with CDR, rather than raw offensive stats, can lead to healthier gameplay for other players (less bursty damage patterns). We do still want some degree of trade off for CDR to be made, particularly regarding when in your build you get it though, or exactly how much you get (what's more important, bigger crits from IE or max CDR early from ER? Rylai's slow early or getting to 30% so blue buff will cap you out?).

The mid-season patch changes were intended to give better access to CDR to mages, particularly those willing to give up some early offensive stats for more CDR/defensive builds. Athene's was changed because of how heavily overlapped with Morello's it was, the two items had always occupied very similar spaces to the extent only one was ever popular. It's not intended to be appealing to most mages at this point, only those with shields/heals who already play somewhat like supports, hence its use of mana regen.

Why is Morellonomicon the only item with high AP and CDR now, though? 
It feels more mandatory than ever now.

Compare that to ADC attack speed items, where they can choose between Shiv, RFC, PD and Hurricane, which all give very similar stats (with some even sharing build paths), but have different actives to choose from.

After Morellonomicon, you are compelled to either buy defensive items or use CDR runes if you want to max CDR.
Plus, I must admit that buying defensive items on a champion whose normal build already caps CDR now feels bad, because the extra is wasted.
Yeah, there are a couple of missing holes in AP/CDR itemization we still need to fill, another AP+20% CDR item in particular.

Could Netherstride Grimoire help fill that hole? 

+100% base mana regeneration
+100 ability power
+20% cooldown reduction

UNIQUE â€“ MALICE: Gain 20% movement speed for 2 seconds whenever you deal ability damage.

It may require a bit of tuning, and the regen should be changed to flat mana, but it seems like a good item to bring back into the game.

Haunting Guise provides a valuable stat (flat magic penetration) that mages can't get anywhere else but boots, but the item is hampered by the fact that Liandry's Torment is much more niche than the item it builds from.

Compare to the AD counterpart, Serrated Dirk, which builds into three other items, giving a variety of reasons to buy it and remain comfortable in doing so.

Can't you just make it so Morellonomicon's CDR isn't Unique? That way players can get 200 AP, 800 mana and 40% CDR in two item slots, which is very decent.

CDR should be a choice with a _meaningful_  downside. The meaningful downside, for an offensive champion, is loss of damage per "cast". 

Therefore items that give high AP, or items that give "extra spells", should not have CDR on them. 

otherwise they become "overall best offensive item ever" on account of having all the offensive stats in one neat package while the supposed "tradeoff" is a bunch of tank stats you don't want anyway. 

P.S.  you should seriously consider removing sorc boots (and compensate spell damage across the board). They constrain mage item choices by their very existence.
how about tricksters hourglass :3 i was a huge fan of it {{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}
It was a fun item, but I think it would quickly get very annoying in a more serious game mode.

Morello indeed feels mandatory **for people who want CDR**. AP Assassins and Burst Mages, and some Battle Mages too, don't scale much with CDR, so they go for RoA or Luden or some stuff like that. Think Annie, her goal is to kill you in one rotation, she doesn't care about CDR, or Swain, who want to drain-tank you with his ult, he doesn't care about CDR either.
Yeah, I more meant "this is the only choice if I want lots of AP and CDR" rather than "I feel I need to buy this on absolutely everyone."

well, i totally agree, but how is that a problem? An item being core for some champs is common. Look at Sunfire or Black Cleaver or Rylai. Lots of champs just rush this kind of item whatever the match-up.

I have to point out an inconsistency with riots stances here, and i hope i can prompt some discussion on your part 

Xypherous from the PBE boards: 
http://boards.pbe.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/champions-gameplay-feedback/79cto3EB-planned-69-mana-x-mp5-x-ap-x-mr-item-pass?show=rundown

> Put it another way - Supports do need mana regen - but more so than that, they deserve strong mana regen.

> They are the character class that has the least amount of agency over their individual position - and thus the class most deserving of going infinite with regards to resources. The more you decide to help your team rather than be an individual carry - the closer to 100% uptime you get to be as you basically have very little individual choice about when to recall or how to move around the map.

Supports get mana regen because their nature is that they need to stay in the field to support their team, and often dont get to back on their schedule because of their teams needs. Mages get flat mana because they have more agency over their map movements ie when to back. 

ok fine, so why then do supports get flat wards that they have to back in order to refresh (sightstone+sweeper) while everyone else gets theirs refreshed while staying out (warding totem). 

If supports are supposed to be able to get closer to 100% uptime then why is sightstone designed to force them to back and why are others wards refresh for them.

I fully agree with your post, but I often tag Meddler for short questions, and he usually comes in, post a short answer, and never comes back again. He is very busy and often answer to a few short questions but very rarely take the time to answer to something long and/or complex.

I suggest you make a new full thread of its own, with as concise an explanation as possible, and as precise a question as possible. Then post it in the middle of the day with "@Meddler" in the title ;)

probably a good idea. I'll have to think about how to word it better to try to attract attention though, and i also know that he revisits threads he's commented on a few hours/days after he has done so to take a look at the conversation. 

Its also a matter of there might not be a good way to present this because either answer (supports should or should not have 100% uptime) is probably going to call someone at riot out for contradicting other rioters in some way. I remember (but i can't find it right now) rioters defending both sides of this saying that sightstone cant have renewable wards because supports shouldn't have 100% uptime but now they've stat bound mana regen to supports for the opposite reason. 

I don't really need a direct answer from him on this, because calling out another rioter's mistake just probably isn't worth the response, i just hope that at least i can spur on a conversation that they have internally at riot so they can make supports one way or the other consistently.

It's not as much calling someone's error as it is getting what their current view is. Design principles evolve, and new idea may emerge. But it's always good to know the principles behind a decision, it helps understand it and accept it.

As for **this** decision, it may not be as contradictory as it seems at first glance. If supports deserve high uptime because their goal is to enable others, so they don't chose when to act, they just react to the others' action, then it doesn't really apply to vision, because vision is precisely the only thing that supports actively control and manage on their own terms. I didn't answer that at first because what I want is a Red answer with the reality, not anons like myself theorizing on many plausible hypothesis*, but it shows that there may be a consistent explanation to this apparent contradiction.

Heck, if you look back at my OP, that's exactly what I did in this thread: "here is an apparent contradiction, could you tell us why it is like that?"

######(Theorizing between anons is fun and productive when it's about possible evolution and suggestions for the future, when it's about the how to change thing, or the why things **should be** changed. But when it's about why things **have been** changed, I find it rather pointless: there is nothing to actually discuss, there is an actual truth.)
What's your take on 40~45% cdr on recourseless champions IE Riven Garen Kat Shyvana Renekton etc who aren't gated by mana costs. But instead are just use it when it's up kind of champions

Those champions are typically designed with the idea that they are made to be spamming whenever possible, hence no resource in the first place. They have some other thing in return: Katarina really gains no benefit from CDR, Garen is highly vulnerable to kitting, Riven is dependent on snowballing, Renekton's weaker late game, etc.
"Uninstall" is never an appropriate comment, but in this case, his post clearly says "late" game.

Is there any new plan for mages to build ap with armor besides zhonya or any ap items with more ap since zhonya's ap has been lowered?

Was there any concern that the new Athene's would add unintended power to Lux support? She's already a pretty decent poke support, but gaining the ability to heal her teammates with her shield is quite a big spike in her utility.

People complained that AP didn't have as much access to CDR, so Riot complied. The side effect of that is that damage AP lost access to mana regen, instead turning to flat mana. So you can spam more now, but if you do that too much you'll run out

That doesn't really answer my question, and I like to believe Riot is not making design decisions just based on people complaints around here.

And I wouldn't say the loss of Mana regen is a "side effect" of the increased CDR. You could still have Mana Regen on Morello and CDR on Zhonya and Abyssal, it's 2 unrelated decisions, even if they are guided by the same principles.

Not really. When mages had virtually unrestricted resources (as that's what the old mans regen basically did), f you wanted max CDR,  you had to make a sacrifice in your runes, or have a low damage/unoptimized build (for most APs). If you then gave the same low restriction resource access to the max CDR levels, **without** sacrificing damage or defense from runes or other items, you have a problem.
